articles.author: STEVE PEOPLES and ZEKE MILLER
articles.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Over and over, from the massive stage in the electric convention hall, the Democrats this week predicted Kamala Harris would defeat Donald Trump.
articles.title: The 'joyful' Democratic convention is over. The real test for Kamala Harris' campaign now begins

articles.author: LISA MASCARO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — “Electric.” “Joyful.”The kinetic energy powering Kamala Harris ’ whirlwind presidential campaign carries the hopeful aspirations of history and the almost quaint idea of electing the first woman to the White House.
articles.title: 'It's our time': As Harris accepts the nomination, many women say a female president is long overdue

articles.author: JOSH BOAK, BRIAN SLODYSKO and NICHOLAS RICCARDI
articles.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris urged Americans to seize a “precious, fleeting opportunity” to move beyond political divisions and the threat of Republican Donald Trump on Thursday as she closed out the Democratic National Convention.
articles.title: Harris' big moment, Dems' rising stars, Gaza protesters shut out. Takeaways from DNC's last night

articles.author: FATMA KHALED
articles.description: CAIRO (AP) — When Mostafa Qadoura was a week old, an Israeli strike on his home in the Gaza Strip last October launched him and his crib into the air, sent shrapnel into his right eye that damaged it beyond repair and killed one of his brothers.
articles.title: A baby evacuated from Gaza lost an eye and most of his family in the war

articles.author: HANNA ARHIROVA
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Friday during a brief visit that many in Ukraine hope will pave the way for an Indian role in peace mediation.
articles.title: Indian Prime Minister Modi meets Ukrainian President Zelenskyy in Kyiv

articles.author: GLENN GAMBOA and THALIA BEATY
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Forward Through Ferguson has made its mark on its community and the St. Louis region by focusing on justice and education, racial equity and policing reform.The Missouri nonprofit was founded in 2015 to enact the societal changes outlined in the Ferguson Commission report to address the issues that contributed to the police shooting death of Michael Brown Jr. and the riots that followed in Ferguson, Missouri.
articles.title: With their massive resources, corporations could be champions of racial equity but often waiver

articles.author: MATT BROWN and AARON MORRISON
articles.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris, on the night she became the first woman of Black and South Asian heritage to be a major party’s presidential nominee, didn't explicitly mention the racial and gender firsts she would set if elected to the White House.
articles.title: Kamala Harris' racial and cultural firsts were onstage throughout the Democratic convention

articles.author: BEN FINLEY
articles.description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va. (AP) — Archaeologists in Virginia are uncovering one of colonial America's most lavish displays of opulence: An ornamental garden where a wealthy politician and enslaved gardeners grew exotic plants from around the world.
articles.title: Archaeologists in Virginia unearth colonial-era garden with clues about its enslaved gardeners

articles.author: JONATHAN J. COOPER and ALI SWENSON
articles.description: PHOENIX (AP) — Robert F. Kennedy Jr. withdrew from the ballot in Arizona late Thursday, a day before he and Donald Trump were set to appear miles apart in the Phoenix area as speculation grows that Kennedy could drop his independent presidential bid and endorse the Republican nominee.
articles.title: RFK Jr. withdraws from Arizona ballot as questions swirl around a possible alliance with Trump

articles.author: MARCO DI MARCO and DAVID KEYTON
articles.description: GRINDAVIK, Iceland (AP) — A volcano in southwestern Iceland erupted Thursday evening for the sixth time since December, spewing red lava through a new fissure on the Reykjanes Peninsula.The eruption began shortly after 9 p.m.
articles.title: An Iceland volcano erupts again but spares the nearby town of Grindavik for now
